file_content.text: I surrender, I surrender! Please, I don't want to die. I know why you're here, and you're wasting your time.
I'm here for Skavak and my starship. Where are they?
Where's my ship?
Skavak is long gone. He left here hours ago.
Is that so?
We were tipped off. We knew all about you before you even walked in here.
I'm here to kill you.
I'm begging you. Let me leave here alive, and I swear I'll quit the separatists for good.
Dareg was stupid to fight you. He got everyone killed when he should've just told you the truth.
You're just stalling.
There's no truth.
No, you have to believe me. There's a lot more going on here than you know.
Keep talking.
I'll tell you everything. I'll do anything if you let me live.
Dareg got his, and you're next.
Shut up and die.
Wait! Wait, I can tell you how to find your ship! Isn't that what you want?
Skavak showed up a few hours ago to deliver the guns, but it was all a trick.
He pretended to be on our side so he could steal some rusty antique droid from Dareg.
Skavak came here to steal a droid?
Droid?
Some worthless pile of scrap that'd been in Dareg's family for generations.
Serves you right for trusting Skavak.
And you fell for it.
Dareg was furious. He thought Skavak was committed to our cause.
That doesn't even make any sense.
That's ridiculous.
I know! Skavak helped us out a lot. We thought he was one of us.
That droid was ancient--practically useless--but Skavak grabbed it like some big treasure and blasted his way out.
He left in your ship. I don't know where he went, but I can guess who does. Skavak has a girl at Fort Garnik named Syreena.
You're telling me Syreena's with Skavak?
What?
They go way back, from what I've heard. They've been scamming Viidu all along.
That can't be.
It's true! Dareg talked to her on the holo all the time with messages for Skavak. She was our main contact.
Syreena just made my hit list.
I'll kill her.
She deserves it. She tried to get you killed.
It was Syreena who warned us you were coming.
If you want to find out where Skavak went, Syreena's the one who knows.
Syreena has a lot of questions to answer.
Time to go have a chat.
Stop giving advice.
Guess I need to decide if you live or die.
What should I do with you?
Please, let me go. I have a family back on the mainland. Please.
Separatist scum killed my family, and I promised myself I'd bury every last one of you.
I--I've only been here a few months. I didn't kill anyone's family. I only ever followed orders.
Then I order you to die.
Belay that order, Corso.
Stop!
Captain, I need to do this.
Are you sure about this, Corso? The man seems sincere.
This feels wrong.
Sincerity has nothing to do with it. Every one of these motherless scum deserves death.
I can't just let him go home and pretend like nothing ever happened!
He could be useful if he switches sides.
So recruit him.
He's right. I can be useful. I can help the government fight the separatists. Just give me a chance.
Would your family want you executing people?
Think about this.
My family were farmers, not soldiers.
Please, I swear to you I'll never serve a man like Dareg again. I'll just go home and take care of my family.
Get out of here before I change my mind.
Thank you.
Come on, Captain. We need to have a little heart-to-heart with Syreena.
Go ahead and shoot him. I'm too tired to argue.
Fine, you win.
I'll make this quick. It's more than you deserve.
You heard the man, soldier.
Orders are orders.
Please, I don't want to die like this!
We're done here. Let's go see what Syreena has to say for herself.
I'm done fighting for the separatists, you have my word. I'll never come back here again.
Congratulations, you get a second chance. Don't blow it.
You're free to go.
Just get moving.
Thanks for letting me live. I won't forget this.
Actually, you won't be leaving.
I don't believe you. [Attack]
No, please!
Don't talk to me; talk to Dareg. He's in charge here.
